channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: Kucam ovaj tvit iz Va≈°ingtona i opet mislim da je ovakvo razmi≈°ljanje idiotsko. Nisu Milo≈°eviƒá i njegovi zloƒçinci sedeli u mraku bez struje i vode dok je NATO obarao trafo stanice po Srbiji. https://t.co/WZcfNrxgeJ

"Pieces of the Action" from Vannevar Bush: a wise old man spins some good tales but can't help making bad predictions. It's almost as if you can't have one without the other. https://t.co/KzvbFNeg0X https://t.co/DjWguC701A

"Kripto tehnologija postoji 14 godina, nije razmontirala dr≈æavu, nije je ƒçak ni ograniƒçila i nema ozbiljnih naznaka da ƒáe to u dogledno vreme moƒái da uradi." Tekstovi @trzisnoresenje su najbolja stvar na srpskom internetu. Sreƒáan roƒëendan! https://t.co/NLngZKYMUz
@stratechery Excellent article, but @benthompson you should put a negative control on these types of graphs if you claim direct correlation. https://t.co/0FKjRyDcXY

"Kripto tehnologija postoji 14 godina, nije razmontirala dr≈æavu, nije je ƒçak ni ograniƒçila i nema ozbiljnih naznaka da ƒáe to u dogledno vreme moƒái da uradi." Slavi≈°ini tekstovi su najbolja stvar koju mo≈æete proƒçitati na srpskom internetu. Sreƒáan roƒëendan! [link]

@nntaleb How old was the patient, and are there any measurements prior to the 42mm?
@nntaleb Without going into possible mechanisms: sudden, large changes in anatomy (*not* destruction, like ischemia or bleeding) tend to be rapidly reversible. Slowly progressing ones tend to stick around, and never go back to baseline even if there is some slow improvement.

"The way I dealt with it is by protecting myself from myself, accepting my fallibility to information, and using filters and tricks to get a representation of the world with as little noise as possible without missing on the significant signal" Med research was like this, briefly [link]
Omikron i vakcine u tri slike [link]

Tekst koji svakim danom Bajdenove administracije postaje sve istinitiji. Od danas je v.d. direktora OSTP-a, kanc. za nauku i tehnologiju, sociolo≈°kinja koja se bavi uticajem rase i pola na tehnolo≈°ki napredak. Njen prethodnik, genetiƒçar, smenjen je zbog neprikladnog pona≈°anja. [link]
@nntaleb In Russia they have another label: useful fools

How does depletion of circulating CD4+ T-cells lead to a clinical hold of a study that investigates anti-CD4 CAR-T therapy? Either there‚Äôs more to this story or someone at the FDA is a dummy (and think what you will of the FDA but they‚Äôre no dummies) [link]
Crypto as catnip for the neuroatypicals ‚Äî their very own string theory [link]
Indeed. US makes it hard both to *become* and *be* a doctor. [link]
@KRakszawski This is 3 years old but I think it held up well [link] You may also like the book ‚ÄúA world without email‚Äù from Cal Newport.

Brilliant essay. I learned this soon after becoming a parent: I didn‚Äôt need more than 4‚Äì5 hours of sleep/day. Sure, you get sleepy if bored, but it‚Äôs easy not to be bored if you avoid bad lectures, dull books, unnecessary meetings. And the opposites of those get me more animated! [link]
@ArtirKel Interesting parallels to clinical trial protocols. A long process that has many gatekeepers with veto power leads to overstuffed, illegible documents that no one can fully grasp.
@Ljiljana1972 Just like @nntaleb's recollection of the Lebanese civil war. "You know when it starts. Never when it ends‚Ä¶" [link]
NB: US has been "failing" since the 1970s. But there is no better disinfectant than sunshine and clean air. If you wonder about the alternatives look no further than Wuhan. [link]

Talk about non-Lindy: AAP‚Äôs recommendations have an automatic 5-year expiration date, unless explicitly renewed. They are treating clinical guidelines like a carton of milk. You have to be totally ignorant of human psychology to think this is sound policy. #RWRI [link]

@Willyintheworld @adamcifu Agree, in part. The threat of IRBs for clinical research is a bit exaggerated, other roadblocks are underappreciated. It‚Äôs possible we don‚Äôt have as many RCTs in children because regulatory overhead inflates costs (in both time and money), and there are fewer research $s in peds.

And in less than 2 decades, AAP went from No Peanuts Until Age 3! to promoting early introduction of peanuts to infants at high risk of developing allergy. Which makes you think about how they came up with their originial recommendation‚Ä¶ [link] https://t.co/6FqkTXxedL
@rationalwalk Twitter has many good 3rd-party apps that remove promoted tweets and do not play around with the timeline. @tweetbot and @Twitterrific are the best.
